detailed_info.name: Stearamidopropyl Dimethylamine
detailed_info.description:
Stearamidopropyl Dimethylamine is a cationic surfactant used as a substitute for silicones in hair care products. It combines quite easily with the hair (negatively charged) to form a smooth film, but while not occlusive as a silicone. It adheres to the fabric surface to reduce static electricity present. It is a hair conditioner that becomes quaternary ammonium in acidic medium. Given its unecological manufacturing process, the ingredient is not authorized in France but in Germany Yes (BDIH).

The Cosmetic Ingredient Review (CIR) concluded in 2014 the safety of Stearamidopropyl Dimethylamine.
detailed_info.reference:
CIR - Safety Assessment of Fatty Acid Amidopropyl Dimethylamines
as Used in Cosmetics (2014) - http://www.cir-safety.org/sites/default/files/FAADs.pdf

functions.description: Reduces static electricity by neutralizing electrical charge on a surface

functions.name: Emulsifying
functions.description: Promotes the formation of intimate mixtures between immiscible liquids by modifying the interfacial tension (water and oil)

functions.name: Hair conditioning
functions.description: Leaves hair easy to comb, soft, soft and shiny and / or confers volume, lightness and shine
